snippet: The House Intelligence Committee said telecommunications equipment from Huawei Technologies and ZTE could be used for spying in the United States.
abstract: House Intelligence Committee says Chinese firms Huawei Technologies and ZTE Inc are national security threat because of their attempts to extract sensitive information from American companies; holds their telecommunications equipment could be used for spying in the United States.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT, KEITH BRADSHER and CHRISTINE HAUSER
byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt reported from Washington and Christine Hauser from New York. Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Hong Kong, and Quentin Hardy from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: The House Intelligence Committee said telecommunications equipment from Huawei Technologies and ZTE could be used for spying in the United States.

headline.seo: U.S. Panel Calls Huawei and ZTE ‘National Security Threat’
headline.main: U.S. Panel Cites Risks in Chinese Equipment
headline.print_headline: U.S. Panel Cites Risks In Chinese Equipment
